taskId.description: A unique identifier for a task
taskId.$comment: This is a GUID, generated when a task is instantiated

taskTitle.$comment: This value is defined during creation of a process template.

taskDescription.$comment: This value is defined during creation of a process template.

taskReferenceList.description: Reference data to support completion of the task
taskReferenceList.$comment: Array of task reference objects. These values are defined during creation of a process template.

taskApplicationURI.description: URI for supporting applications to help complete task. Value is defined during process tempalte creation.
taskApplicationURI.$comment: This provides user access to an application that can help them compelte their task

taskStatusHistory.description: History of the status of the task
taskStatusHistory.$comment: Each time status of task changes, insert Task Status Object into this array. See taskStatusObject definition for more information.

taskRoles.description: Organizational roles responsible for completing this task.
taskRoles.$comment: Identifies organizational roles that are expected to complete this task. Recommend assigning tasks to roles whenever possible and only to people when required by use case.

taskOwners.description: Individuals  responsible for completing this task.
taskOwners.$comment: Identifies people that are expected to complete this task. Recommend assigning tasks to roles whenever possible and only to people when required by use case.

taskStatusObject.description: Current status of the task, date status was achieved, and party responsible for status

statusValue.$comment: Initial value can be defined during process template creation or when task is instantiated. Value can be updated during process execution to relect change in status. Organization may wish to define acceptable values.

statusDate.description: Date status of the task was achieved
statusDate.$comment: Value should be set when status is updated. Recommend adopting UNIX Epoch time.

statusOwner.description: Party responsible for setting status value
statusOwner.$comment: Value should be set when status is updated.

taskReference.description: Reference objects provide the name, description, type, and URI for materials that can help a user complete a task

referenceName.$comment: This value is defined during creation of a process template.

referenceDescription.$comment: This value is defined during creation of a process template.

referenceType.$comment: This value is defined during creation of a process template.

referenceURI.$comment: This value is defined during creation of a process template.
